title: FCA Investment Firm Prudential Regime - Capital Requirements
body:
FINANCIAL CONDUCT AUTHORITY HANDBOOK - INVESTMENT FIRM PRUDENTIAL REGIME (IFPR)

MIFIDPRU 4: Own funds requirements

Application

4.1.1 This chapter applies to all MIFIDPRU investment firms.

Minimum capital requirements

4.2.1 BASIC REQUIREMENT:

A MIFIDPRU investment firm must at all times hold own funds of:

(a) SNI firms (small and non-interconnected): £75,000
(b) Non-SNI firms (dealing on own account or underwriting): £750,000
(c) Non-SNI firms (other activities): £150,000

4.3 OWN FUNDS THRESHOLDS:

A firm must calculate its own funds requirement as the higher of:

(a) Permanent minimum capital requirement (PMR) per 4.2.1
(b) Fixed overhead requirement (FOR): one quarter of the firm's relevant expenditure in the previous year
(c) K-factor requirement (KFR): sum of all applicable K-factors

4.4 K-FACTOR REQUIREMENTS:

(a) K-AUM (Assets under Management):
   - 0.02% of AUM up to £1.5bn
   - 0.01% of AUM between £1.5bn and £10bn
   - 0.005% of AUM above £10bn

(b) K-CMH (Client Money Held):
   - Segregated client money: 0.4% of total
   - Non-segregated client money: 0.5% of total

(c) K-ASA (Assets Safeguarded and Administered):
   - 0.04% of total value safeguarded

(d) K-COH (Client Orders Handled):
   - Cash trades: £0.1 per £1m of orders
   - Derivatives: £0.01 per contract

(e) K-DTF (Daily Trading Flow):
   - 0.1% of average daily trades

(f) K-NPR (Net Position Risk):
   - Market risk capital requirement under MIFIDPRU 6

(g) K-CMG (Clearing Margin Given):
   - 0.8% of clearing margin posted

(h) K-TCD (Trading Counterparty Default):
   - Based on exposure to trading counterparties

4.5 CAPITAL CONSERVATION BUFFER:

Firms must maintain a capital conservation buffer of 2.5% of total risk exposure, consisting of Common Equity Tier 1 capital.

4.6 CONCENTRATION RISK:

(a) Single client exposure must not exceed 25% of own funds
(b) Exposures to UK or EU credit institutions may reach 100% of own funds
(c) Large exposures (>10% of own funds) must be reported quarterly

4.7 LIQUIDITY REQUIREMENTS:

Basic liquid assets requirement:

(a) Minimum: One-third of fixed overheads from previous year
(b) Composition:
   - Tier 1 (cash, central bank reserves): no limit
   - Tier 2 (government bonds rated AA- or above): maximum 60%
   - Tier 3 (corporate bonds rated A- or above): maximum 15%

4.8 STRESS TESTING:

Non-SNI firms must conduct:
(a) Internal liquidity stress testing: quarterly
(b) Reverse stress testing: annually
(c) ICARA submission to FCA: annually

4.9 EARLY WARNING INDICATORS:

Firms must notify the FCA within one business day if:
(a) Own funds fall below 110% of requirement
(b) Basic liquid assets fall below 110% of requirement
(c) Any threshold breach occurs

4.10 REPORTING:

(a) MIFIDPRU 8 annual reporting: within 4 months of year-end
(b) Quarterly data returns: within 30 calendar days
(c) Ad-hoc breach notifications: within 1 business day
(d) Annual ICARA assessment: within 4 months of year-end

4.11 REMUNERATION REQUIREMENTS:

Firms must ensure that variable remuneration:
(a) Does not exceed 100% of fixed remuneration (or 200% with shareholder approval)
(b) Is subject to malus and clawback provisions
(c) Is deferred over 3-5 years for material risk takers

4.12 GOVERNANCE:

The firm's governing body must:
(a) Approve the ICARA annually
(b) Review capital and liquidity adequacy quarterly  
(c) Maintain minutes of all discussions on prudential matters
(d) Ensure senior management function holders have appropriate competence

4.13 SUPERVISORY POWERS:

The FCA may:
(a) Impose capital add-ons up to 3% of K-factor requirement
(b) Require additional reporting
(c) Restrict or suspend permissions
(d) Impose fines up to the greater of £500,000 or 5% of revenue
(e) Prosecute for criminal offences under Financial Services and Markets Act

4.14 TRANSITIONAL RELIEF:

Firms have 6 months to comply from the date this rule enters into force. The FCA may grant extensions on a case-by-case basis for up to an additional 6 months.

This instrument comes into force on 1 February 2024.
